metadata.synopsis: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -625.75, 14.74, 354.754. Talk with Elder Brithvar, convince him you are not a true soul (deception roll) and accept to help him.5. CTRL-Shift-K the Scrying eye.6. Destroy the rubbles holding Nere captive.7. Side with Brithvar and use CTRL-Shift_K to kill Brithvar and all of the loyals + Nere.8. Walk to the center of the main room.

75.speaker: Kirgrath
75.text: Hold up, jargh. Y-you ain't just walking away.
75.context: NodeContext: Aggressive in their words, but something hesitant. They're afraid of you, they just don't want to show it.

40.speaker: Kirgrath
40.text: You got Brithvar chopped - and I still haven't seen a damned coin for my trouble.

17.speaker: Kirgrath
17.text: You owe - what's the word? Restitution.  ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

54.speaker: Kirgrath
54.text: That, or - or I add your corpse to the heap. Which is it?

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *You sense hesitation. The duergar talks tough, but fears you.*

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I had a deal with Brithvar. You owe me, not the other way around.

96.speaker: Kirgrath
96.text: Deal's off, jargh. He told you to squish that floatin' eyeball. Now the damn thing's seen us kill Nere.

60.speaker: Kirgrath
60.text: Clan's got a cult-army on its hands thanks to you. So pay up. I'll take gold - or your head.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You're afraid, and you should be. Ask for money again, and I'll gut you.

58.speaker: Kirgrath
58.text: Stinking rakkah. If Brithvar was here...

87.speaker: Kirgrath
87.text: Clan, wrap it up. We've scraped this place for all its worth.
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

79.speaker: Kirgrath
79.text: It's time I scram, before the buggers at Moonrise charge in.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: And the slaves? What about them?

3.speaker: Kirgrath
3.text: They belong to the clan. They're coming with us.

77.speaker: Wyll
77.text: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: You sure they're worth dying over?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Set them free, or I will thrash you like I thrashed Nere.

7.speaker: Kirgrath
7.text: These shitheads aren't worth the hassle. You got yourself a deal.

56.speaker: Kirgrath
56.text: You're free, squatties. Get your legs moving, before I change my damn mind.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

24.speaker: Kirgrath
24.text: Go on, then. Been itching to cut you down a peg.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Let the gnomes go. They'll just slow you down.

22.speaker: Kirgrath
22.text: Yeh might be right about that. The more bodies we got, the slower we move.

68.speaker: Kirgrath
68.text: Nah. They slow us down, I hold fire to their arses. You should see 'em dance!

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Good idea. They're a valuable asset.

67.speaker: Kirgrath
67.text: Damn right. We'll keep them busy - this isn't their last dig.

76.speaker: Wyll
76.text: Your heart made of stone? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

15.speaker: Gale
15.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: Whoa. What?! You can't be serious.

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

27.speaker: Karlach
27.text: Absolutely not. The gnomes walk free. Right?

80.speaker: Player
80.text: What makes Moonrise Towers such a threat?

51.speaker: Kirgrath
51.text: Place is swarming with Absolute-buggers - a whole army. And I ain't gonna mess about with them.
51.context: NodeContext: Abs-so-LUTE buggers. As in, god-shaggers.

26.speaker: Kirgrath
26.text: Some General up there giving the orders, the way Nere told it.

94.speaker: Kirgrath
94.text: They got goblins, drow, gnolls, even humans - ain't no one they won't try to turn. The clans included.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Get moving. If I see you slavers again, I'll tear you apart.

72.speaker: Kirgrath
72.text: You think? I catch so much as a whiff of you, and I'll have you flayed and fried up for dinner.

101.speaker: Kirgrath
101.text: Now move out of here - I got shit to be doing.
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

46.speaker: Kirgrath
46.text: You don't need to ask twice, jargh.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: You're no Brithvar. Let me go, and I won't humiliate you in battle. Deal?

102.speaker: Kirgrath
102.text: I - fine. Can't dig for gold when I'm dead, eh?

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Don't be ridiculous. I don't have that kind of gold.

30.speaker: Kirgrath
30.text: Then I'll have to see what price your head fetches. Zavagh!
30.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

85.speaker: Player
85.text: You're mad if you think I owe you a single coin.

99.speaker: Kirgrath
99.text: That so? Then your corpse should be more than willing. Zavagh!
99.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

1.speaker: Player
1.text: You've got this backwards. You keep your head, and I pay you nothing.

97.speaker: Kirgrath
97.text: I... fine. You ain't worth the trouble anyway.

19.speaker: Kirgrath
19.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I killed Nere for you. That's payment enough.

74.speaker: Kirgrath
74.text: Shit. That's how it is, eh?
74.context: NodeContext: Said with a sigh at the beginning.

43.speaker: Kirgrath
43.text: AHH! SHIT! F-fine, I'm not dealing with whatever that was.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: He steps back scared at the roarNodeContext: Scared by roar, then a touch embarrassed

37.speaker: Kirgrath
37.text: Hah! Did you just roar at me, you freak? Zavagh!

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I can smell your fear so bad I can taste it. Go beg someone else.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Restitution, my arse. You'll find what you need on Nere's corpse.

91.speaker: Kirgrath
91.text: Shit - fine. Never could see eye to eye with a clan-sen.

41.speaker: Kirgrath
41.text: Drugnin' Brithvar. I'm lost without him. He'd have this jargh pissin' with fear.

36.speaker: Kirgrath
36.text: You - you're in my head, aren't you? That ain't right, damn it. Zavagh!
